body:
> Pjax also does it asynchronously: yiisoft/jquery-pjax@7a47df7

`$.getScript(src).done(next).fail(next)` does it work asynchronously? It calls for the next JS only when previous is done or failed, it was the main idea. Or I have misunderstood you?

> If the same script file is requested again while the first request is still loading, it will immediately be aborted. 

Why the new JS could be requested again? 
We have three ways to get a new JS: as a result of AJAX or PJAX requests or not as a result of request (loaded JS injects another `<script>`).
Both of the AJAX and PJAX requests are being passed through `ajaxPrefilter`. The third option is not a normal behaviour at all, so I think we shouldn't take care of it.

> $.getScript(src).done(next).fail(next) does it work asynchronously? It calls for the next JS only when previous is done or failed, it was the main idea. Or I have misunderstood you?

"only when previous is done or failed" -> that's the problem. The prefilter will fail the script that has already been added to `loadedScripts`, even though it's still loading. So `next` will run, and it will execute the inline script.

> Why the new JS could be requested again? 

You click a pjax link, which loads a page that contains activeform. yii.activeform.js is requested, it runs through ajaxPrefilter, and is added to loadedScripts immediately. Before it finishes loading however, you click another link that loads a different page that contains activeform (or even the same link), which again requests yii.activeform.js. Since yii.activeform.js is in loadedScripts, the request for it will immediately be aborted, triggering the evaluation of the next script. If yii.activeform.js has not loaded yet, the inline script will fail.

The solution would be to store promises in `loadedScripts`, resolve them when the first xhr finishes, and only abort the subsequent xhrs when the promises are resolved. You could even store the xhr object itself, since it also implements the Promise interface.

edit: that won't work, since it's not possible to delay the xhr in a prefilter.

Now it's clear for me, thank you very much for the detailed explanation.

Would you like to deal with it and make a PR? :)

issue.title: Fixed race condition in yii.js AJAX prefilter

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

Closes #10358

The PR fixes race condition in AJAX prefilter.

Waiting for reviews from someone else.

@nkovacs

body: @Alex-Code thank you for the idea, but it looks rather as a hack. I'd not like to implement it
